title: DIRECTOR DEALS: Ashmore Group's boss sells £15m worth of shares
text:
The boss of emerging markets investment firm Ashmore Group gave his bank account a healthy top-up this week.

Mark Coombs, 59, sold £15million worth of shares after a shareholder advice firm warned last year there was a risk of him gaining 'creeping control' over the company.

The billionaire, who founded Ashmore in 1998, has promised to sell up to 4 per cent of his shares in the company per year to reach a more 'appropriate level' of investment.

He is still the largest shareholder, owning 37 per cent of the business.
